sen.j: 春日 顕国（かすが あきくに、生年不詳 - 興国5年/康永3年3月8日 (旧暦)（1344年4月21日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の貴族。
sen.e: Akikuni KASUGA (year of birth unknown - April 21, 1344) was a nobility in the period of the Northern and Sothern Courts (Japan).
Akikuni KASUGA (year of birth unknown - April 21, 1344) was a noble in the period of the Northern and Sothern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Akikuni KASUGA (year of birth unknown - April 21, 1344) was a noble during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: He belonged to the Minamoto clan.
He belonged to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He belonged to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 家系は村上源氏庶流の春日家。
sen.e: He was a member of the Kasuga family, which was a branch of Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was a member of the Kasuga family, which was a branch of Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was a member of the Kasuga family, which was a branch of Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 正三位・源顕行の子か。
sen.e: It is assumed that Akikuni was a son of MINAMOTO no Akiyuki, a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
It is assumed that Akikuni was a son of MINAMOTO no Akiyuki, a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni is believed to be a son of MINAMOTO no Akiyuki, who held the senior third rank at court.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 官位は左近衛中将、侍従。
sen.e: Akiyuki's official rank was Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and a jiju (a chamberlain)
Akiyuki's official rank was Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and a jiju (a chamberlain)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni held two official positions, Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and jiju (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 春日中将、春日侍従と称された。
sen.e: He was called "Middle Captain Kasuga" and "Jiju Kasuga."
He was called "Middle Captain Kasuga" and "Jiju Kasuga."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was called "Middle Captain Kasuga" and "Jiju Kasuga."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 諱は顕時とも。
sen.e: He had another imina (personal name), "Akitoki."
He had another imina (personal name), "Akitoki."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His personal name was Akitoki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 南朝 (日本)方の武将として北畠親房・北畠顕家の下で転戦した。
sen.e: He took part in various battles under Chikafusa KITABATAKE and Akiie KITABATAKE as a warrior of the Sothern Court (Japan).
He took part in various battles under Chikafusa KITABATAKE and Akiie KITABATAKE as a warrior of the Sothern Court (Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As one of the military commanders of the Southern Court faction, he fought in several battles under Chikafusa KITABATAKE and Akiie KITABATAKE.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 陸奥守鎮守府将軍北畠顕家に従い東国に下向、南朝方として転戦する。
sen.e: Following Akiie KITABATAKE, who was Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North), Akikuni went to eastern provinces and took part in various battles.
sen.cmt: 「東国」は「the eastern provinces」としました。
sen.e: Following Akiie KITABATAKE, who was Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North), Akikuni went to eastern provinces and took part in various battles.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni followed Akiie KITABATAKE, who was both the governor of Mutsu Province and the Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North), into the eastern provinces, fighting for the Southern Court in various battles there.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 建武 (日本)2年（1335年）顕家の命により、小山城を多田貞綱とともに攻撃している。
sen.e: In 1335, receiving Akiie's order, Akikuni attacked Koyama-jo Castle with Sadatsuna Tada.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1335, receiving Akiie's order, Akikuni attacked Koyama-jo Castle with Sadatsuna Tada.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1335, Akikuni and Sadatsuna TADA assaulted Koyama-jo Castle on orders from Akiie.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 小山城は、足利方である小山氏の本拠であった。
sen.e: Koyama-jo Castle acted as the base for the Koyama clan who were on the Ashikaga side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Koyama-jo Castle acted as the base for the Koyama clan who were on the Ashikaga side.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Koyama-jo Castle was functioning as the base of operations for the Koyama clan, who were allied with the (enemy) Ashikaga faction.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 11月7日には北朝方の茂木城を攻略する。
sen.e: On November 7, Akikuni captured Motegi-jo Castle which had belonged to the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On November 7, Akikuni captured Motegi-jo Castle which had belonged to the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On December 29, Akikuni captured Motegi-jo Castle which had belonged to the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: 本文中は旧暦になっているようですので、グレゴリオ暦に変換しました。

sen.j: しかし、城主の茂木知貞に再び奪い返される等、攻防を繰り返す。
sen.e: Fierce fighting continued as the castle was taken back by the lord of the castle, Tomosada MOTEGI
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fierce fighting continued as the castle was taken back by the lord of the castle, Tomosada MOTEGI
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: But Akikuni and the Southern Court forces were constantly gaining and losing the upper hand in the war, switching back and forth between going on the attack and falling back onto the defense, as for example when Tomosada MOTEGI, the lord of Motegi-jo Castle, managed to recapture the castle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 顕家の死後は、その父である親房の傘下に入る。
sen.e: After the death of Akiie, Akikuni came under the protection of Akiie's father, Chikafusa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the death of Akiie, Akikuni came under the protection of Akiie's father, Chikafusa.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After Akiie's death, Akikuni became a direct subordinate of Chikafusa, Akiie's father.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 常陸国の小田治久の小田城に入り親房の幕僚となる。
sen.e: Akikuni entered Oda-jo Castle belonging to Haruhisa ODA in Hitachi Province and became one of Chikafusa's staff officers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Akikuni entered Oda-jo Castle belonging to Haruhisa ODA in Hitachi Province and became one of Chikafusa's staff officers.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni occupied Hitachi Province's Oda-jo Castle, which belonged to Haruhisa ODA, and became one of Chikafusa's staff officers.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当時、常陸国南朝方は常陸北部の那珂郡にある瓜連城を拠点に大掾高幹・長岡宣政ら常陸平氏、那珂通辰ら那珂、川野辺氏を従えた楠木正成の代官楠木正家、公卿の広橋経泰らが、北朝方の佐竹氏らと拮抗していた。
sen.e: At the time, the Sothern Court side in Hitachi Province was based on Urizura-jo Castle in Naka district of Northern Hitachi and whose members included Hitachi-Heishi (Taira clan) such as Takamoto DAIJO and Nobumasa NAGAOKA, Masaie KUSUNOKI, the local governor of Masashige KUSUNOKI, followed by the Naka clan such as Michitoki NAKA and the Kawanobe clan, and Tsuneyasu HIROHASHI, a Court noble.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外用語には、川野辺氏を「Beshi KAWANO」と訳すように指定されていますが、「the Kawanobe clan」としました。
sen.e: At the time, the Sothern Court side in Hitachi Province was based on Urizura-jo Castle in Naka district of Northern Hitachi and whose members included Hitachi-Heishi (Taira clan) such as Takamoto DAIJO and Nobumasa NAGAOKA, Masaie KUSUNOKI, the local governor of Masashige KUSUNOKI, followed by the Naka clan such as Michitoki NAKA and the Kawanobe clan, and Tsuneyasu HIROHASHI, a Court noble.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At that time, the Southern Court faction supporters in Hitachi Province included the court noble Tsuneyasu HIROHASHI, Hitachi Heishi (Taira clan) family members like Takamoto DAIJO and Nobumasa NAGAOKA, as well as Masaie KUSUNOKI--the local governor appointed by Masashige KUSUNOKI--and his followers among the Naka clan, such as Michitoki NAKA, and among the Kawanobe clan; they were based out of Urizura-jo Castle, located in Naka county in northern Hitachi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 彼らは、北朝方の佐竹氏らと拮抗していた。
sen.e: They opposed the side supporting the Northern court including the Satake clan and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They opposed the side supporting the Northern court including the Satake clan and others.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From here, they were fighting against the Satake clan and the others of the Northern Court faction.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 春日顕国は下野国の宇都宮氏と対峙していた。
sen.e: Akikuni KASUGA confronted the Utsunomiya clan of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Akikuni KASUGA confronted the Utsunomiya clan of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni KASUGA confronted the Utsunomiya clan of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 延元元年/建武3年（1336年）、南朝方の春日顕国・楠木正家軍は北朝方の佐竹義春軍と戦う。
sen.e: In 1336, the Sothern-Court Army under the control of Akikuni KASUGA and Masaie KUSUNOKI fought the Sothern-Court Army under the control of Yoshiharu SATAKE.
In 1336, the Sothern-Court Army under the control of Akikuni KASUGA and Masaie KUSUNOKI fought the Sothern-Court Army under the control of Yoshiharu SATAKE.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1336, the Southern-Court Army under the control of Akikuni KASUGA and Masaie KUSUNOKI fought the Northern-Court Army under the control of Yoshiharu SATAKE.
sen.cmt: Northern としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 延元4年/暦応2年（1339年）2月、下野を攻め宇都宮氏を支える紀党益子氏の矢木岡城・益子古城・上三川城・箕輪城を攻略。
sen.e: In February, 1939, the Sothern-Court Army attacked Shimotsuke Province and captured Yagioka-jo Castle, Mashikoko-jo Castle, Kaminokawa-jo Castle and Minowa-jo Castle on where the Kito Mashiko clan supporting the Utsunomiya clan had established their base.

In February, 1939, the Sothern-Court Army attacked Shimotsuke Province and captured Yagioka-jo Castle, Mashikoko-jo Castle, Kaminokawa-jo Castle and Minowa-jo Castle on where the Kito Mashiko clan supporting the Utsunomiya clan had established their base.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In February, 1339, the Southern Court army invaded Shimotsuke Province and captured Yagioka-jo Castle, where the Kito Mashiko clan--supporters of the Utsunomiya clan--had established their base, also taking Mashikoko-jo Castle, Kaminokawa-jo Castle and Minowa-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 興国2年/暦応4年（1341年）には宇都宮氏を支える清党・芳賀氏の飛山城を攻略し宇都宮氏の両翼を挫いた。
sen.e: In 1341, the Sothern-Court Army captured Tobiyama-jo Castle on which the Haga clan of 清党, supporting the Utsunoymiya clan was based and destroyed both of the enemy's wings.
sen.cmt: 清党の読みと訳がわからず、日本語のままになっております。
sen.e: In 1341, the Sothern-Court Army captured Tobiyama-jo Castle on which the Haga clan of 清党, supporting the Utsunoymiya clan was based and destroyed both of the enemy's wings.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1341, the Southern Court army captured Tobiyama-jo Castle, which was the base for the the Seito Haga clan (who were descended from the Kiyohara clan), who were also Utsunomiya clan supporters, and thus annihilated both of the enemy's flanks.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 常陸国では中郡城をも攻略し、一時居城とするが、後に北朝方に奪回される。
sen.e: They also captured Chugun-jo Castle in Hitachi Province and established their base there for a while, but it was taken back by the Southern-Court Army later.
They also captured Chugun-jo Castle in Hitachi Province and established their base there for a while, but it was taken back by the Southern-Court Army later.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In Hitachi Province, they also captured Chugun-jo Castle, which they temporarily used as a base of operations, but it was later retaken by the Northern Court army.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし同年、足利氏の家臣・高師冬の切り崩しにより南朝方の有力武将・小田治久が北朝方に下ってしまった。
sen.e: In the same year, however, KO no Morofuyu, a vassal of the Ashikaga clan had successfully split the Southern-Court Army and one of its prominent warrior, Haruhisa ODA went over to the Northern Court side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the same year, however, KO no Morofuyu, a vassal of the Ashikaga clan had successfully split the Southern-Court Army and one of its prominent warriors, Haruhisa ODA went over to the Northern Court side.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In the same year, however, KO no Morofuyu, a vassal of the Ashikaga clan, had successfully managed to split the Southern Court army, which led one of its most powerful warriors, Haruhisa ODA, to switch sides and join the Northern Court faction.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 親房は南朝方の関宗祐・関宗政親子の拠る関城、春日顕国は小山氏の一族下妻氏が拠る大宝城に興良親王を奉じてそれぞれ移った。宝城が関東における南朝方の拠点となった。
sen.e: Chikafusa moved to Seki-jo Castle where Munesuke SEKI and Munemasa SEKI of the Southern-Court Army were based and Akikuni KASUGA, serving Imperial Prince Okiyoshi, moved to Daiho-jo Castle where the Shimozuma clan, a family belonging to the Oyama clan was based.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chikafusa moved to Seki-jo Castle where Munesuke SEKI and Munemasa SEKI of the Southern-Court Army were based and Akikuni KASUGA, serving Imperial Prince Okiyoshi, moved to Daiho-jo Castle where the Shimozuma clan, a family belonging to the Oyama clan was based.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Chikafusa shifted his headquarters to Seki-jo Castle, where Munesuke SEKI and Munemasa SEKI of the Southern Court army were based, while Akikuni KASUGA, in service to Imperial Prince Okiyoshi, moved to Daiho-jo Castle, where the Shimozuma clan, a family belonging to the Oyama clan, was based.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、関城並びに大宝城が関東における南朝方の拠点となった。
sen.e: After this, Seki-jo Castle and Daiho-jo Castle became the bases for the Southern-Court Army in Kanto.
After this, Seki-jo Castle and Daiho-jo Castle became the bases for the Southern-Court Army in Kanto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Thereafter, Seki-jo Castle and Daiho-jo Castle became the headquarters for the Southern Court army in the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、興国4年/康永2年（1343年）大宝城・関城は落城した。
sen.e: However, in 1343, Daiho-jo Castle and Seki-jo Castle had fallen.
However, in 1343, Daiho-jo Castle and Seki-jo Castle had fallen.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: But in 1343, Daiho-jo Castle and Seki-jo Castle were both captured by the enemy.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 北畠親房は吉野に帰還するが、顕国はそのまま残り再び挙兵した。
sen.e: Chikafusa KITABATAKE returned to Yoshino, but Akikuni remained in Kanto, raising yet another army.
Chikafusa KITABATAKE returned to Yoshino, but Akikuni remained in Kanto, raising yet another army.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Chikafusa KITABATAKE returned to Yoshino (where the Southern Court was located), but Akikuni remained in the Kanto, trying to raise another army.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そして、興国5年/康永3年（1344年）3月8日、顕国は甥ら一族とともに北朝方に捕縛・処刑された。
sen.e: On March 8, 1344, Akikuni was captured by the Northern-Court side together with his nephews and other members of his clan and they were executed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 8, 1344, Akikuni was captured by the Northern-Court side together with his nephews and other members of his clan and they were executed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On April 21, 1344, Akikuni and several of his nephews and other clan members were captured by Northern Court forces and executed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その遺体は京都に送られた。
sen.e: Akikuni's body was sent to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Akikuni's body was sent to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Akikuni's body was sent to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
